result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Carlos Enrique Diaz-Rivera

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Heather L. Johnson in court for Carlos Enrique Diaz-Rivera.  Attorney Erika Strebel in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for Scheduling Conference. 
Defense in receipt of discovery and offer from the State and request a resolution date. 
Defense  advised to the plea documents 24 hours in advance of the hearing,. 
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.

Attorney Heather L. Johnson in court, defendant Carlos Enrique Diaz-Rivera not in court, in custody.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. 
Defense in receipt of discovery and offer from the State and in negotiations for a global offe  for defendant pending matter before Branch 12. 
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Heather L. Johnson in Court, Defendant Carlos Enrique Diaz-Rivera not in Court, in custody.  Stephan Eduard Nolten on behalf of Alexandria S. Carlson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in Court for Scheduling Conference. Defendant's appearance waived for today's hearing. Discussion placed on the record. Defense advised the Court of Defendant's case, 22CF942, pending in Branch 12. Defense requested a GLOBAL OFFER from the State. Case adjourned for Scheduling Conference.  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 6, Judge Ellen Brostrom, in Room 608 of the Courthouse. Scheduling Conference scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Heather L. Johnson in court, defendant Carlos Enrique Diaz-Rivera not in court, in custody, appearance waived.  William R. F. Ackell appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense is requesting adjourned scheduling conference. Case is adjourned in Branch 45.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Carlos Enrique Diaz-Rivera in court with attorney Heather L. Johnson.  Defendant Carlos Enrique Diaz-Rivera in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO. Sworn as interpreter: Kelly Salas. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 45.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Carlos Enrique Diaz-Rivera not in court, defendant in custody.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Attorney H. Johnson does not appear. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Carlos Enrique Diaz-Rivera not in court, defendant in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Attorney Johnson does not appear. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility due to the non appearance of counsel.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Carlos Enrique Diaz-Rivera not in court, defendant in custody.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Attorney Johnson has intake and is unable to appear. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with B.B; R.M.B ; AND E.J.V
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.

Defendant Carlos Enrique Diaz-Rivera in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Defendant Carlos Enrique Diaz-Rivera in custody.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Carlos Enrique Diaz-Rivera appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.    Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
